questions.neutral: You're not here by accident, are you?

hobby.message: The Council would flinch at your political literature stash.
Freestyle FPV... your kind of silence, right?
Find any ghosts in the tunnels?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Just needed a quiet place. Too much static outside lately.
Got a thing for underground spots, you could say.
Hobby keeps me away from crowds. Safer that way these days.
All this dossier drama makes even solitude feel crowded.
Not an accident, more like routine. I go tunnel exploring for fun.
Lately it's harder, thanks to those protests and guards everywhere.
Guess I like finding the places others avoid.
Collecting old tech scraps used to be simple. Now, everyone's twitchy.
They shut one of my usual entry points last week.
I spend my downtime crawling old service tunnels—urban exploration, you could call it.
Been my thing since before the city got obsessed with order.
These days, everyone's nervous since those Council secrets came out.
Security doubled patrols in spots I used to have to myself.
Found some analog messenger traces. Used to be just me and the pipes.
Now it feels like everyone dodging the system is bumping elbows down there.
Not here by accident, no. Needed a pause after tonight's crawl.
I fix and explore the city’s utility guts—mostly tunnels and forgotten data hubs.
Used to mean solitude. Now, since the Council leaks, even shadows aren’t empty.
Old relay boxes are prime for swapping stories or bits of tech.
Almost tripped over a courier’s stash after the comms blackout—left it untouched.
Security caught me by the heat pump—luckily, they’re worse with maps than me.
Feels like the hobby’s turning into a team sport against my will.
You’re right, Alex. Same as always—needed distance after another tunnel run tonight.
This city’s bones—service mains, sealed networks, rusted access vents—that’s where I lose the noise.
I started poking around years back, just to fix things off the clock.
Now, I watch the city change faster than the Council can lie about it.
The hobby’s not just escape now—it’s the only place where half the stories are true.
Since the dossiers leaked, those old shafts are filling up with couriers, lost tech, even nervous council aides.
Nearly got cornered by patrol tonight. Five minutes under a frozen valve, listening to boots.
Funny—used to be you only had to worry about mold and electrical shorts.
hobby_answer: Never gets boring, Alex.
Places change every week now. Less quiet corners since the dossiers leaked.
Patrols crawl everywhere since the protests.
Used to be all pipes and silence. Now it's waiting and watching.
Better stick to safe routes for a while.
No, it doesn't get boring.
Circuit layouts change, keeps you guessing.
Since those Council files dropped, patrols started popping up even in the tunnels.
More folks down there hiding things, or themselves.
Had a close call the other night — just waited it out.
Doesn't feel like a hobby anymore, more like dodging trouble.
Urban exploration? Still the best way to clear my head.
Tunnels haven’t been this alive since the last maintenance crisis.
Since the dossier leak, even the deep vents are getting visits from patrols.
Found comms caches tucked behind utility panels.
Analog chatter everywhere now — real people, not just echoes of the system.
Had to hide from security last week, first time that’s happened in years.
Hobby’s changed: less exploring, more avoiding eyes.
No chance of it getting boring. Every crawl’s different lately.
Since the system glitched and those Council files hit, everyone’s on edge.
Even the tunnels I used to have to myself are crawling with spooked patrols now.
Sometimes you stumble over couriers, sometimes just kids trying to drop off notes.
Left a relay box untouched last weekend — wasn’t sure who’d booby-trapped it.
Got cornered behind a valve shaft, listened to security talk about 'ghost signals.'
Reminds me of the first blackout years ago. Only difference now? Everyone’s scared.
Still, best place in town if you want out of the algorithm’s line of sight.
Boring? Not lately, not with everything upside down.
Started exploring telco shafts long before Halden showed up — hobby turned habit.
Old days, I was after forgotten tech, now it’s dodging patrols and lost souls.
Since the full Council leak, found more stashed messages than spare circuit boards.
Silence in the tunnels is rare. Got real security, real couriers, even families hiding out.
Stumbled on a cache meant for analog resistance, almost took it by accident.
Had to wait out green recruits arguing over missing ghosts — still shaking by the time I got home.
Feels like we’re all crawling under Stenograd, hiding from the same broken system.
Miss the days when urban exploring was just me, pipes, and maybe a rat for company.
